alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 3:20PM AKST until January 08 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Total snow accumulations up to 16 inches. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. Areas of blowing snow possible. * WHERE...Portions of the Seward Highway between Turnagain Pass and north of Bear Creek. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, rapid snow accumulations on roadways, and periods of reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates have intensified today, peaking at one to two inches an hour late this afternoon. Winds will peak Sunday morning. Highest snowfall accumulations to occur at higher elevations, such as through Turnagain Pass. Snowfall to taper down, but continue falling, through Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
